Posts.Content: Hi Devon Dumpling Thanks for the advice. I’m due to start them tomorrow so will remember to take it out fridge for 30 mins beforehand. I have such a phobia about needles though which isn’t getting any better throughout all this treatment! How are you finding your chemo so far? S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Devon Dumpling Yeah I just had my 2nd chemo on Wednesday and my hair started to go a couple of days before despite using cold cap I used it again on 2nd session in the hope some would stay. I still found it upsetting despite telling myself it was likely to happen even using cold cap. I can’t beat to get it cut but it is going very quickly. I have 2 wigs which actually look really nice and everyone says you can’t tell it’s a wig!  No other side effects apart from the slight nausea but will let you know how the injections go.  Good luck for next week. S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Congratulations TheScriptFan That’s great news. I am also due to be a Grandma (first grandchild) in April. Chemo and surgery should be done by then so it’s giving me something to focus on to get through all this. I’m sure you must be feeling the same. I can’t wait !! S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I’m here until end of Feb. 2nd FEC due on Wednesday. Apart from a bit nausea no other side effects from first treatment. Not kidding myself that this will always be the case so apprehensive again about Wednesday.  S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Had 2nd Chemo yesterday. WBC was enough to get chemo but not great so have been given the injections to take for 7 days to boost for next session. Does anyone have any advice on best time to take these as Chemo Nurse said May feel achy and have flu like symptoms. Also would I need to take them be for every treatment until finished?  Annoying thing is felt ok after first treatment! S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi TheScriptFan & Bluebell22 Thanks for the advice. Has put my mind at rest at bit about these injections. I have a fear of needles so won’t be able to do them myself therefore hubby is going to give it a try! S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Sept78 I am feeling exactly the same. I have had  2/6 FEC-T my 3rd one is due on 26th. My arm felt fine after first treatment, however since 2nd treatment it’s been sore. I’m told it’s cording and common with this treatment. My problem is I have already had some surgery although more to follow so can’t use other arm. The chemo nurse I spoke to said they would only do Hickman line as last resort so don’t know where this leaves me. I got the impression they weren’t keen to do this. I was told to take Ibuprofen and use heat pack on it. I’m going to speak to Oncologist before next treatment for more advice. S
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Pringle68 I haven’t had this type of surgery so not sure about recovery etc. Just wanted to add a bit about travel insurance. I was diagnosed in August last year. We had a break abroad already booked and had taken out an annual travel insurance policy. Phoned them up to ask if would still be covered. I was advised they would cover me for that trip as although diagnosed, treatment had not yet started. I was advised they wouldn’t cover me for any future trips whilst treatment ongoing. It would be worth checking with your insurance company as it may help with your decision.   S
Posts.Title: DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi LH60 I was diagnosed in August  last year. Had a Wide Local Excision in September with no clear margins then a further re-excision in October. Unfortunately no clear margins again so was recommended to start Chemotherapy as 3 lymph nodes involved. After Chemo it was going to be Mastectomy with immediate reconstruction. At my appointment to discuss surgery, my surgeon said he could do another re-excision which came as a surprise to me but I was advised that if that wasn’t successful then it would be Mastectomy. I think they try and preserve the breast as much as they can if possible. I had this done  in April this year and thankfully got the news that the cancer has now been removed. It’s a difficult decision to make and you have to decide what’s best for you I just decided to go on the advice of my surgeon.   I had some lipofilling done as by 3rd op quite a bit of tissue had been removed but I am happy with the results.  Wishing you well with the rest of your surgery and treatment.  S
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or re- excision?

Posts.Content: Hi TheScriptFan I had 2 lumpectomies in Sep and Oct last year prior to chemo    Unfortunately no clear margins so went straight to chemo in November.  I will be having a Mastectomy with reconstruction now that’s why I’m feeling nervous.  I have app with surgeon on Friday. Good luck with your results on 26th  Will keep my fingers crossed for you  You must be looking forward to treatment coming to an end   S x

Posts.Content: Hi I finished chemo FEC -T nearly 3 weeks ago. The last couple of days I have noticed my ankles are swollen (right one in particular). Didnt have this issue during chemo. Just wondered if anyone knows if this is likely to be chemo related or needs to be checked out? Thanks S
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies Think I’m trying to do everything by the book rather than what feels right for me. Will know  better for next time. S
Posts.Title: Temperature during Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Just looking for advice really. Should you be checking temperature everyday for the full duration of treatment or just for a period after each treatment.? My temp had been below 36 for several days. (Had first treatment 7 days ago) Had a sore throat but felt ok. Phoned helpline for advice and was advised to get checked over. Spent nearly 6 hours at hospital most of which was waiting to speak to a doctor who told me in 2 mins everything was fine. (That was despite showing them the card stating I was receiving chemo) Dont want to go through that again if I don’t need to so just really wanted to know howl long after treatment everyone else is checking temp S

Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn14 I started my chemo today but different from yours. Mines is FEC-T. It’s 6 cycles once every 3 weeks. It was just to say I used cold cap and it was ok ( cold but bearable). I know it doesn’t work for everyone but I thought I would at least give it a go as it would make me feel better if it helped to reduce hair loss. The only downside is length of time you need to wear it. I will know by next treatment if it’s working and can decide if I’m going to continue.  S
